title: Jujutsu Kaisen Phantom Parade Tier List
description: Explore the best characters in Jujutsu Kaisen Phantom Parade with our in-depth tier list, ranking each character from S to C tier based on their abilities, synergy, and impact on the game.
heading: Jujutsu Kaisen Phantom Parade Tier List
introText: Explore the best characters in Jujutsu Kaisen Phantom Parade with our in-depth tier list, ranking each character from S to C tier based on their abilities, synergy, and impact on the game.

data.itemDescription: With immense cursed energy and skills like Six Eyes and Limitless, Gojo is the strongest sorcerer. He can obliterate enemies in a single strike, making him invaluable in turn-based combat
The main character and vessel of the Curse King, Yuji combines superhuman strength, speed, and stamina, placing him among the game's top-tier characters
Known for his destructive moves and Ultimate, which deals significant damage. He pairs well with Yuji, creating an unbeatable duo
A Grade 1 sorcerer and skilled swordsman; his precise strikes make him effective in eliminating enemies with swift cuts
Despite his Grade 2 status, Megumi’s high stats and skillset make him formidable. He excels with shikigami summons and weapon skills, adding strong tactical options to the team
Although she lacks sorcerer powers, Maki's exceptional combat skills and weapon mastery allow her to stand against powerful foes. Ideal for players who prioritize physical prowess over jujutsu
With his unique cursed speech ability, Toge can control or damage enemies with his words. His powerful, dynamic skill animations make him a distinctive choice
The school’s principal and skilled puppet master, Yaga brings versatility with his ability to control corpses, though his power level is limited in battle
A Grade 3 sorcerer whose abilities are largely copy-pasted from her anime counterpart, placing her in Tier B. Her weapon play is engaging, but she excels more in defense than offense
Created by Masamichi Yaga, Panda has two transformations and decent jujutsu skills. Despite his versatility, his damage output rarely surpasses triple digits
Considered one of the most well-rounded characters in Phantom Parade, though he lacks scale. Unlike his anime persona, this former Kamo Clan heir doesn’t display the same killer instinct
Maki’s twin sister with limited jujutsu skills, but skilled with firearms. While she looks cool in battle, her moves lack significant impact

A fusion of technology and sorcery, effective in early stages but struggles against stronger curses. Feels overpowered at first, but shows limits as enemies grow tougher.
Saki Rindo & Kaito Yuki: Both exclusive to the game and first-year students at Fukuoka Jujutsu High. Their raw skills reflect their inexperience but hint at potential if you’re able to unlock it
A current student with minimal jujutsu skills. Despite her training, her abilities are lackluster in combat
Another student with very limited jujutsu. Her skill set is below average, making her one of the weaker characters
More suited to administrative work than combat, Ijichi struggles in the game’s turn-based RPG format
A healer who uses the Reversed Curse Technique to support teammates. Though not strong in combat, her healing abilities justify her place in the game
